title: Week in pictures: 9 - 15 July 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: 'Stress can't fly, that's just how it is'
description: A paramotoring pilot says he wants to help more ex-soldiers to get into the sport.

title: ‘I thought being black meant I couldn’t get skin cancer’
description: One woman warns others to learn from her mistakes and use sunscreen.

title: China heatwave: Shanghai workers swelter in 40C heat
description: Shanghai is one of dozens of cities across the country to issue extreme weather warnings.

title: Euro 2022: Why England are team to fear at tournament
description: England reached the quarter-finals of Euro 2022 in impressive style and this is why no-one will want to play them...

title: The next PM: The first debate in 90 seconds
description: The five candidates hoping to be the next Tory leader faced off in front of a studio audience.

title: Nova Scotia shooting: Gunman's partner describes night of terror
description: Lisa Banfield, who was with the gunman for 19 years, said she was "so scared I didn't want to move".

title: Austria 1-0 Norway: Two-time tournament winners out of Euro 2022
description: Norway failed to reach the European Championship knockout stages for the second tournament in succession after being beaten by Austria,.

title: Rail passengers told to avoid travel in heatwave
description: Network Rail says people should only travel if necessary, and services could be delayed or cancelled

title: Europe heatwave: Thousands escape wildfires in France, Spain and Greece
description: Residents and visitors flee towns and villages in France, Spain and Greece as high winds fan fires.

title: How do the rich and famous protect their homes?
description: As a man is jailed for a burglary at ex-footballer Ashley Cole's home - how are celebrities protecting their property?

title: Heatwave: Schools to close or let children wear PE kit to keep cool
description: Some schools are closing, and others are taking extra steps as temperatures could hit 40C.

title: Jayland Walker: Autopsy shows black man 'shot or grazed' 46 times
description: Officials in the city of Akron are bracing for more protests amid calls for a federal investigation.

title: Brenda Venables: The 40-year mystery of the missing farmer's wife
description: How the decades-old evidence of David Venables' secret mistress helped convict him of murder.

title: Covid booster: Will be offered to all over 50s this autumn
description: More people than originally planned will be offered the jab in the UK ahead of the coming winter.

title: What are the heat exhaustion and heatstroke symptoms?
description: Know the signs and what to do if someone is unwell in hot weather.

title: Morocco wildfires: Toxic smoke and raging blazes
description: Scorching temperatures and drought feed fires in the north of the country.

title: Queen makes surprise visit to open new Maidenhead hospice
description: The Queen visits Maidenhead to officially open the new Thames Hospice centre.

title: Woman, 24, dies after north Wales paddleboard rescue
description: The 24-year-old woman died after getting into difficulty paddleboarding off the coast near Conwy.

title: Sarina Wiegman: England manager tests positive for Covid
description: England manager Sarina Wiegman tests positive for Covid prior to the team's final group game against Northern Ireland on Friday.

title: Drone footage shows seal trying to hide from orca hunt
description: A seal has been captured on drone footage using mussel farm lines to try to escape an orca hunt.

title: Heatwave: National emergency declared after first red extreme heat warning
description: The heatwave is being treated as a national emergency and contingency plans are in place, No 10 says.

title: Channel 4 rejects Nadine Dorries' Tower Block of Commons fakery claim
description: Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries claimed actors were used in reality show Tower Block of Commons.

title: Forced adoptions: Call for government apology to mothers
description: More than 180,000 women in the 1950s, 60s and 70s were "shamed" into giving up babies, report says.

title: Archie Battersbee: Court rules life-support can end
description: A judge says continuing treatment for the 12-year-old is "futile", but his family plans to appeal again.

title: Ukraine war: British man Paul Urey held by separatists dies
description: British man Paul Urey, captured by Russian-backed separatists, has died in detention, reports say.

title: One in 20 has Covid in the UK
description: UK infections up nearly 30% week-on-week, latest figures show.

title: Manchester United: Frenkie de Jong's move from Barcelona held up
description: Manchester United agree a £63.5m deal for Frenkie de Jong but the Netherlands midfielder's move is held up by a contract dispute with Barcelona.

title: The Open 2022: World number one Scottie Scheffler sinks three birdies in a row
description: Watch as world number one Scottie Scheffler sinks three birdies in a row on the second day of The Open at St Andrews.

title: Shaking head and mean goose among new emojis
description: Fewer new emojis will be available for text and online messages than in previous years.

title: Tom Hanks learned Saving Private Ryan lines from helmet on Irish beach
description: Tom Hanks and Steven Spielberg set up camp on an Irish beach 25 years ago.

title: Tom Tugendhat: From wars in Iraq and Afghanistan to front line at Westminster
description: A profile of the former soldier now bidding to be Conservative leader and prime minister.

title: Kemi Badenoch: Anti-woke campaigner making waves
description: Profile of the former equalities campaigner, who has been the surprise package of the Tory leadership race.

title: Haiti fuel terminal reopens but gang war persists
description: The terminal shut down because of battles between rival gangs and its closure caused petrol shortages.

title: Constance Wu says she tried to kill herself after tweets backlash
description: The US actress says she attempted suicide due to "internet shaming" following her "careless tweets".

title: Mabel says social media comments made her want to quit
description: The 26-year-old singer hit a breaking point over comments on her posts and moved back home.

title: UK skin cancer deaths higher in men than women
description: There are about 1,400 deaths a year from melanoma in men, compared to 980 in women, says Cancer Research UK.

title: Ryan Reynolds sends support to Newcastle heart-op boy
description: Deadpool star Ryan Reynolds was contacted by the dad of a 13-year-old undergoing open-heart surgery.

title: In pictures: Buck Moon rises over England
description: Photographs capture the biggest and brightest supermoon of the year lighting up England's skies.

title: Chris Mason: TV debates can catapult or crush reputations
description: Scrutiny of the Tory leadership rivals is about to crank up and the next vote seems a long way off.

title: Periods: Company offers staff time off and flexible working
description: When Megan Thompson feels unwell, her employer gives her flexibility to take time out or time off.

title: Rail workers to strike for another two days in August
description: Workers at Network Rail and 14 train operators will now strike on 18 and 20 August, as well as 27 July.

title: Inside the London comedy club where heckling is banned
description: The Poodle Club in Sydenham is turning the tables on the male-dominated world of stand-up comedy.

title: Big Butterfly Count: People asked to join in to help address extinction
description: Conservationists says two-fifths of British species are under threat.

title: Ivana Trump: Glamorous immigrant who became a US institution
description: She was a competitive skier, fashion model, socialite, hard-driving businesswoman and author.

title: She treated Myanmar's resistance and paid with her life
description: Zarli Naing's decision to help Myanmar's underground resistance cost the young nurse her life.

title: Cost of living: 'I've had to rummage in bins for food to eat'
description: Demand is rising at a food bank just as donations drop, while concerns grow about the coming winter.

title: Disability and the heatwave: Cooling solutions and disability as weather alert goes red
description: As the temperature rises what are the challenges faced by disabled people?

title: Tory leadership race: Where do candidates stand on net zero goal?
description: Not all the candidates want to push ahead with policies designed to de-carbonise the economy by 2050.

title: The unintended side effects of a Grammy nomination
description: A new study suggests that artists who are nominated for an award but don't win often stop taking risks.
